thread.title: Porto midfielder Hector Herrera shows off foot injury in gruesome snap… after playing on for 40 minutes
thread.title_full: Porto midfielder Hector Herrera shows off foot injury in gruesome snap… after playing on for 40 minutes

author: fnathan
title: Porto midfielder Hector Herrera shows off foot injury in gruesome snap… after playing on for 40 minutes
text:
that's some feet Porto midfielder Hector Herrera shows off foot injury in gruesome snap… after playing on for 40 minutes 
Injury occurred during Portuguese giants' poor 2-0 home defeat to Juventus in the Champions League last night By Fred Nathan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PORTO’S 2-0 home defeat to Juventus in the Champions League last night will have been painful for their players – and in the case of Hector Herrera, literally so. 
The Mexican midfielder revealed a horror gash to his foot sustained in a second-half collision with Juve defender Stephan Lichtsteiner. Array 3 The nasty injury suffered by Hector Herrera for Porto against Juventus 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Swiss defender was rightly shown a yellow card for the nasty challenge – but incredibly, Porto captain Herrera played on for 40 minutes with the deep cut. 
The 26-year-old played the entire match, as 10-man Porto disappointingly lost 2-0 loss thanks to goals from Marko Pjaca and Dani Alves. Getty Images Juventus’ midfielder Sami Khedira battles with Porto’s Herrera last night related stories Samir Nasri insists Arsenal players must take the blame for failure... not under-fire Arsene Wenger GOT IT MADE IN CHINA Manchester United overtake Bayern Munich as the most popular football team in China… but Bundesliga is still most followed league TEAM NEWS Which teams are playing, when are they in action and what are their line-ups? Gunning for Gibbs Danny Welbeck reveals he used to 'hate' Arsenal team-mate Kieran Gibbs when he played against him for Manchester United bren gun Ray Parlour believes Celtic's Brendan Rodgers could be the man to replace Arsene Wenger as Arsenal boss Saints go East Southampton targeted by Far East investors as China's largest investment bank lines up £225million bid THIERRY HENRY Arsene Wenger must see something in his Arsenal players in training that we don’t ian wright Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino should go all out and try to win the derided Europa League PUT IT WRITE Southampton legend Lawrie McMenemy writes touching letter to Claude Puel ahead of EFL Cup final SANTI KO Santi Cazorla set to miss rest of the season with ankle injury in huge blow for Arsenal's top-four charge ABU HAVING FUN? Manchester City's stars arrive at their luxurious 5-star Emirates Palace Abu Dhabi hotel - where the cheapest room is £500 A NIGHT PAY CUT Dimitri Payet merchandise still on sale at West Ham shop for knockdown prices 
A picture emerged after the match of two bloody gashes on the top of his left foot – and now he is a major doubt for their league trip to Boavista this weekend. 
The influential midfielder’s absence will be a big blow to Porto, who are just one point behind league leaders Sporting Lisbon in the league. Getty Images 3 Herrera managed to play on for the rest of the match despite the cut 
Juve were helped to their two priceless away goals last night by Alex Telles’ red card for Porto in the 27th minute for two bookable offences.
